text.section:
The General Assembly finds that:
a system for periodic, legislative review of the regulatory, licensing, and other governmental activities of the Executive Branch of the State government is essential for the maintenance of a government in which the citizens have confidence and of a healthy State economy; and
this legislative review is consistent with other activities and goals of the General Assembly.

The purposes of this subtitle are to:
establish a system of legislative review that will:
determine whether a governmental activity is necessary for the public interest; and
make units that are responsible for necessary governmental activities accountable and responsive to the public interest; and
ensure that the legislative review takes place by establishing, by statute, dates for the review and other legislative action.
